instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the identification study of mineral pigments on wall paintings?
Output: The identification study of mineral pigments on wall paintings used LIBS technology, which stands for Laser-Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the identification study of mineral pigments on wall paintings?
Output: The SelectKBest algorithm was used to screen the spectral characteristics in the identification study of mineral pigments on wall paintings.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the identification accuracy in the identification study of mineral pigments on wall paintings and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the identification accuracy in the identification study of mineral pigments on wall paintings was the accuracy rate. The accuracy rates for the identification models ranged from 64.67% to 94% for actual mural samples.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the study to identify mineral pigments on wall paintings with similar chemical compositions?
Output: The machine learning models used in the study to identify mineral pigments on wall paintings with similar chemical compositions were K-nearest neighbor algorithm (KNN), random forest (RF), support vector machine (SVM), back propagation artificial neural network (Bp-ANN), and convolutional neural network (CNN).

instruction: How does the identification accuracy of the 2D-CNN model compare to other models in the study for actual mural samples?
Output: The identification accuracy of the 2D-CNN model for actual mural samples was above 94%, which was higher than the identification accuracy of other models in the study.
